title: Farmer Requesting Permission to Marry a Nobleman's Daughter

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of graphite and pen and black ink, with touches of opaque, white watercolor on cream laid paper.

medium_display: Graphite and pen and black ink, with touches of opaque, white watercolor on cream laid paper
inscriptions: Inscribed verso, lower center, in pen and black ink: “Le Jardinier et son Seigneur (Sedaine) / Gabriel de St. ["t" in superscript] Aubin del. 1761”
credit_line: Gift of Jeffrey E. Horvitz in honor of Suzanne Folds McCullagh
publication_history:
Émile Dacier, L'OEuvre gravé de Gabriel de Saint-Aubin (Paris: Imprimerie Nationale, 1914), p. 148.

Émile Dacier, Gabriel de Saint-Aubin: peintre, dessinateur et graveur (1724–1780) (Paris: Éditions G. Van Oest, 1931), vol. 2, no. 899, p. 165.  

Seymour de Ricci, Dessins du dix-huitième siècle: Collection Albert Meyer (Paris: Jean A. Seligmann, 1935), no. 87, n.p. (ill.).
exhibition_history:
Paris, Galerie Charpentier, Exposition des Saint-Aubin, 1925, cat. 34, p. 43.  

Paris, Hôtel Jean Charpentier, Exposition des Arts au Théatre, 1925, cat. 87, p. 37.  

Middletown, Davison Art Center, Wesleyan University, Prints and Drawings by Gabriel de Saint-Aubin, 1724–1780, Mar. 7–Apr. 13, 1975, cat. 44, pp. 78–79; traveled to The Baltimore Museum of Art, Apr. 25– June 8, 1975.  

London, Artemis, Master Prints and Drawings: 15th to 20th Centuries, 1990, cat. 29.  

Paris, Petit Palais, Tradition & Transitions: Eighteenth-Century French Art from The Horvitz Collection, 2017, cat. A.892, p. 625.  

Jacksonville, Cummer Museum of Art and Gardens, Imaging Text: French Drawings for Book Illustration from The Horvitz Collection, May–June 2018, cat. 61, p. 11 and 69; traveled to Sarasota, The John and Mable Ringling Museum of Art, Sept.–Dec. 2018; and the Fairfield University Art Museum, Jan.–Mar. 2019.
provenance_text: Jacques-Victor, Comte de la Béraudière (1808–1884), Paris [his sale (Delestre et Chevallier), Paris, April 16–17, 1883, lot 250 (unsold)]; his estate sale, Hôtel Béreaudière (Escribe et Chevallier), Paris, May 18–30, 1885, lot 176 to Henri Lacroix (died 1893), Paris [according to Dacier 1931]; Gustave Mühlbacher (died 1906), Paris [without his mark (Lugt 1180); Lugt states that Mühlbacher acquired most of his collection from Lacroix]; his sale, Galerie Georges Petit (Chevallier), Paris, May 15–18, 1899, lot 251.  Sigismond Bardac (1856–1919), Paris.  Marius Paulme (1863–1928), Paris, by 1925 [stamped (Lugt 1910), lower left, in black; Paris 1925]; his estate sale, Galerie Georges Petit, Paris May 13–14, 1929, lot 236.  Albert Meyer, Paris, by 1931 [Dacier 1931]; sold, Galerie Charpentier, Paris, June 15, 1938, lot 43, probably to Germain Seligman (1893–1978), New York [without his mark (Lugt 3863); according to annotated auction catalogue; copy in curatorial object file].  Richard (Ricardo) Pénard y Fernandez (1882–1960), Paris.  British Rail Pension Fund, London.  Rosenberg & Stiebel Gallery, New York, by 1975 [Middletown 1975].  Artemis, London, by 1990.  Sold, Drouot (PIASA), Paris, Nov. 20, 2001, lot 99, to Jeffrey E. Horvitz; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2023.

input: Farmer Requesting Permission to Marry a Nobleman's Daughter
